text:
On shutdown, the session attributes which implement HttpSessionBindingListener 
aren't called back (method valueUnbound).
creator: thibault.frey@libertysurf.fr
cmanolache@yahoo.com
text:
Finally done, it was a stupid error in the context shutdown, where the 
session was put into EXPIRED state and that called recycle() before the servlet
facade got a chance to clean up. 
The fix is to first put it in SUSPEND state ( and like on reload, the values
that implement HttpSessionListener will be resolved ), then remove it. 

BTW, this could be extended ( later ) to implement "checkpoints" and other 
fancy things. 

Now everything seems to work fine, I'll check them in after I remove the
prinlns()
